TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit JsonConverter`1<T> extends System.Text.Json.Serialization.JsonConverter
Public MustInherit Class JsonConverter(Of T) Inherits JsonConverter
generic <typename T> public ref class JsonConverter abstract : System::Text::Json::Serialization::JsonConverter

Docs.typeparam: The type of object or value handled by the converter.
Docs.summary: Converts an object or value to or from JSON.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
For more information, see [How to write custom converters for JSON serialization](/dotnet/standard/serialization/system-text-json-converters-how-to).

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyorassemblyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed
.method public hidebysig virtual instance bool CanConvert(class System.Type typeToConvert) cil managed
Public Overrides Function CanConvert (typeToConvert As Type) As Boolean

Docs.summary: Determines whether the specified type can be converted.
Docs.returns: if the type can be converted; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks
The default implementation is to return `true` when `typeToConvert` equals `typeof(T)`.
For more information, see [How to write custom converters for JSON serialization](/dotnet/standard/serialization/system-text-json-converters-how-to#steps-to-follow-the-basic-pattern).

Docs.param: An object that specifies serialization options to use.

For more information, see [How to write custom converters for JSON serialization](/dotnet/standard/serialization/system-text-json-converters-how-to#steps-to-follow-the-basic-pattern).

Docs.param: The value to convert to JSON.
An object that specifies serialization options to use.
Docs.summary: Writes a specified value as JSON.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
A converter may throw any exception, but it should throw <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonException> when the JSON cannot be created.
For more information, see [How to write custom converters for JSON serialization](/dotnet/standard/serialization/system-text-json-converters-how-to#steps-to-follow-the-basic-pattern).
